availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Asa F. Parker (Henderson County, Kentucky, brick mason and brick maker)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, brick mason and brick maker. Kentucky native. Married to Jane M. Parker. Father of Mary E. Parker, Sarah Jane Parker, Susannah Parker, and A. C. Parker. Married to Olive Clark Parker on October 24, 1853. Father of F. J. Parker, Catharina S. Parker, John F. Parker, Harry Parker, and David Parker. Brick mason in Henderson County in 1850. Brick maker in Henderson County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Illinois, Monroe County, Columbia, p. 96; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson, Division 1, p. 47; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson, Division 1, p. 7; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson, Ward 4, p. 11; Jordan Dodd and Liahona Research, comp., Illinois Marriage Index, 1851-1900, Ancestry, Monroe County, Illinois, October 24, 1853.
